On Fri, 24 Jan 2003, clairegknowles <mail@...> wrote:

> I am currently writing a web application which uses the Websphere
> connection pool. I can write tests for the rest of my applciation,
> how to I test connections to the db, and objects which use the db
> connections without having to run the websphere server?

Use separate interfaces to get the connection from the pool and do work
with the connection. I do something like this (the error handling may be
a bit simplified):

    Object doMyThing(Connection con, String something)
    {
	// do stuff on the connection and return the object.
    }

    public Object doMyThing(ConnectionFactory factory, String something)
    {
	Connection con = factory.getConnection();
	return doMyThing(con, something);
	con.close();
    }

The database test code invokes the first method; the real users of
the code invoke the second. The second method isn't tested, because
there's just not much there to break. If something did break in it, the
functional tests catch it.
